data.name: plRestrictFolder.Help
data.value: Select one folder if you want to restrict what users can see to one of the folders in the list. Through the tree, you will also be able to navigate to subfolders and documents belonging to the selected folder.

data.name: plRestrictCategory.Help
data.value: Select one category if you want to restrict what users can see to one of the categories in the list. Through the tree, you will also be able to navigate to subcategories and documents belonging to the selected category.

data.name: plMode.Help
data.value: Select the default navigation tree mode you prefer. The tree can be shown as organized by folders, or by categories.

data.name: plModeToggle.Help
data.value: Check this option if you want to allow users to change the navigation tree mode. If you choose not to allow toggling, then users will only see the tree organized by either folder or category, withouth the possibility to switch between the two views. [Administrators will continue to see the toggle options for administartive purposes]

data.name: plRootFolder.Help
data.value: Select a root folder, to store the folders and documents, in the physical drive. When a folder is selected from the list, the Database and the File System are automatically synchronized.

data.name: plAllowedExtensionsAdd.Help
data.value: This setting allows you to enable the file extensions that are allowed in the document library. Available extensions are configured by the host server.

data.name: plSecureFiles.Help
data.value:
If checked, this option will protect your documents from direct download by renaming them to a type of extension that is not directly served by a Web Server [.resx]. As a result, the only possible way to access the document will be through the document library interface.

When unchecked, this option will allow documents to be downloaded directly from a web browser or to be referenced by links.

data.name: plConfirmDownload.Help
data.value:
When checked, this option will show a pop-up window with additional information, before a download is started.

If unchecked, the download will start directly.

data.name: cmdRootFolderEnable.Text
data.value: Enable/Disable Selection of a new Root Folder

data.name: cmdRootFolderSync.Text
data.value: Synchronize the Database and the File System

data.name: cmdRootFolderSyncOff.Text
data.value: To Synchronize the Database and the File System you need to disable the selection of a root folder

data.name: cmdRootFolderSyncAlert.Text
data.value: You are about to Synchronize the Database and the File System.\n\nOnce completed, you will be able to review the results in the Synchronization Log.

data.name: plHideTree.Help
data.value: Select this option to hide the navigation tree. Choosing this option will automatically display all the documents under the folder/category, including all the documents in subfolders/subcategories. It is necessary to specify a folder/category when this option is selected. This can be done by either selecting a folder/category from one of the restriction lists, or by passing the ID of the folder/category in the URL. [Administrators will continue to see the navigation tree for administartive purposes]

data.name: plHorizontalScroll.Help
data.value: By Default, the navigation tree grows in size (horizontally and vertically) according to the number of folders that are open at any one time. Allowing Horizontal Scrolling will prevent the tree from growing in width, and present the user with the possibility to scroll to the right or left, in order to see the folders.

data.name: plDisplayDocumentDescription.Help
data.value: Select this option to view the description field of the document in the Document grid.

data.name: plDisplayDocumentSize.Help
data.value: Select this option to view the size field of the document in the Document grid.

data.name: lnkRootFolderSyncLogAlert.Text
data.value: There is no Synchronization Log to display

data.name: plRootFolderSync.Help
data.value: Synchronize the Database and the File System.\n\nOnce completed, you will be able to review the results in the Synchronization Log.

data.name: plStatsLogDays.Help
data.value: Enter the number of days that you want to retain folder, category and document statistics information.

data.name: plModuleStyle.Help
data.value: Select the module style from the list of available styles

data.name: plVersioning.Help
data.value: Versioning will allow you to save a specified number of copies of the documents you upload. Every time you re-upload a new version of the same document, the previous version is saved and can be restored on demand.

data.name: plVersioningMaxNumber.Help
data.value: Maximum number of versions to be saved for each document.

data.name: plDisplayDocumentName.Help
data.value: This option cannot be selected. The name field of the document in the Document grid is required.

data.name: plDisplayDocumentUploaded.Help
data.value: Select this option to view the name of the person that uploaded as well as the date of the document in the Document grid.

data.name: cmdRootFolderEnableAlert.Text
data.value: Clicking this option will allow you to change the Root Folder.\n\nOnce you update your changes, the Database and the File System will be automatically synchronized.

data.name: chxSecureFilesAlert.Text
data.value: Changing this option will allow you to protect or unprotect your files from direct download.\n\nOnce you update your changes, the Database and the File System will be automatically synchronized.

data.name: plSearch.Help
data.value: The Search section will allow you to set search options for the documents.

data.name: plDNNSearchEnabled.Help
data.value: Selecting this option, allows the documents to participate in the default DNN Search. The searchable fields will include the Name and the Description of the document. Please Note: the default DNN Search does not index document content. Also, it does not implement any kind of security. Therefore, unauthorized users may see descriptions for documents they may not have access to. Such documents will still be download protected.

data.name: plDisplayNavigation.Help
data.value: By deselecting this option, you will be removing the navigation (paging) and info mechanisms at the top and bottom of the grid. As a result, all items in the list will be displayed at once.

data.name: plItemsPerPage.Help
data.value: The number of items that will bee displayed in the grid.

data.name: plGridLayout.Help
data.value: Select the layout to be applied to the document grid, from the list of available layouts

data.name: plDisplayDocumentIcon.Help
data.value: Select this option to view the icon that correspondes to the document type.

data.name: plTreeStyle.Help
data.value: Select a tree style. Tree styles differ in the iconsets used and the consequent look and feel of the tree structure.

data.name: plEnableWebDav_lnk.Help
data.value:
This option will display an alternative 'open on server' button in the documents grid, next to the 'download\' button. Clicking on the 'open on server' button will present a pop-up with the following options:
  • Open Option: Selecting the Open option, will open the application in its corresponding application. The [save] and [save as] options will save any changes directly on the server.
  • Save Option: not applicable, do not use [use the download button instead].
  • Cancel Option: cancels the operation.


Note 1: The folder must be a WebDav folder [you will need to configure the server]. You can check if the current root folder is correctly setup as a WebDav folder, by clicking on the icon next to the 'Enable WebDav' checkbox.

Note 2: In case that WebDav is not correctly setup on the server, and this option is selected, the document will still open in its corresponding application, but the [save] and [save as] options will only save the document in a local [to your PC] folder.

Note 3: There is no need for any client browser configuration.

data.name: chxEnableWebDavAlertYes_lnk.Text
data.value:
This option will display an alternative 'open on server' button in the documents grid, next to the 'download' button.

Clicking on the 'open on server' button will present a pop-up with the following options:

Open Option: Selecting the Open option, will open the application in its corresponding application. The [save] and [save as] options will save any changes directly on the server.

Save Option: not applicable, do not use [use the download button instead].

Cancel Option: cancels the operation.



Note 1: The folder must be a WebDav folder [you will need to configure the server]. You can check if the current root folder is correctly setup as a WebDav folder, by clicking on the icon next to the 'Enable WebDav' checkbox.

Note 2: In case that WebDav is not correctly setup on the server, and this option is selected, the document will still open in its corresponding application, but the [save] and [save as] options will only save the document in a local [to your PC] folder.

Note 3: There is no need for any client browser configuration.

data.name: chxEnableWebDavAlertNo.Text
data.value: This option is Not Available when the Secure Files option is checked.

data.name: cmdEnableWebDavCheck.Text
data.value: check if WebDav is enabled on the server

data.name: cmdEnableWebDavCheckOK.Text
data.value: webdav is enabled on the server

data.name: cmdEnableWebDavCheckKO.Text
data.value: webdav [or some of its options] does not seem to be enabled on the server or, the server response is not a valid webdav response

data.name: cmdEnableWebDavCheckKOUNCShare.Text
data.value: webdav cannot be enabled for UNC Shares

data.name: plDisplayMedia.Help
data.value: When checked, this option will display a PLAY button for media files (audio, images and video).

data.name: plBoxSize.Help
data.value: Select the size of the box that displays the media content of the documents.

data.name: plMedia.Help
data.value: The Media Content section will allow you to set media content options for the documents.

data.name: chxBigUploadsAlert.Text
data.value:
IMPORTANT: Full trust is required to allow huge uploads. You need to ensure that your web hosting permits you to set Full trust in the web.config. If not, please do not check this option. To set full trust in the web.config, you have to add the following line in system.web section:

<trust level="Full" />

If checked, this option will allow huge uploads (up to 2 GB). Notice that the web.config will be automatically modified (a backup of the actual configuration file will be created on the same folder). And also, a folder will be created in the root folder of the application.

By unchecking it, the changes done to the web.config and the folder in the root folder will be eliminated.

NOTE ON UNINSTALL: Prior to uninstall the module, please uncheck this option, otherwise you will need to manually remove some entries on web.config file and remove the folder that is created on the root folder of the application.

data.name: plBigUploads.Help
data.value:
If checked, this option will allow huge uploads (up to 2 GB). Notice that the web.config will be automatically modified (a backup of the actual configuration file will be created on the same folder). And also, a folder will be created in the root folder of the application.

By unchecking it, the changes done to the web.config and the folder in the root folder will be eliminated.

data.name: plEnableWebDav.Help
data.value:
This option will display an alternative 'open on server' button in the documents grid, next to the 'download\' button. Clicking on the 'open on server' button will open the document in its client environment (MS Word or MS Excel):

Note 1: The folder must be a WebDav folder [you will need to configure the server]. You can check if the current root folder is correctly setup as a WebDav folder, by clicking on the icon next to the 'Enable WebDav' checkbox.

Note 2: In case that WebDav is not correctly setup on the server, and this option is selected, the document will still open in its corresponding application, but the [save] and [save as] options will only save the document in a local [to your PC] folder.

Note 3: You must enable ActiveX controls to run on you client PC, by changing the corresponding Zone Security Options.

data.name: chxEnableWebDavAlertYes.Text
data.value:
This option will display an alternative 'open on server' button in the documents grid, next to the 'download' button.

Clicking on the 'open on server' button will open the document in its client environment (MS Word or MS Excel):



Note 1: The folder must be a WebDav folder [you will need to configure the server]. You can check if the current root folder is correctly setup as a WebDav folder, by clicking on the icon next to the 'Enable WebDav' checkbox.

Note 2: In case that WebDav is not correctly setup on the server, and this option is selected, the document will still open in its corresponding application, but the [save] and [save as] options will only save the document in a local [to your PC] folder.

Note 3: You must enable ActiveX controls to run on you client PC, by changing the corresponding Zone Security Options.

data.name: plThumbnailBackColor.Help
data.value: The thumbnails of images with transparent background need a color to replace transparent pixels with. You can enter here the color to replace with (in hexadecimal format). This setting is optional and will only be valid when layout is set to "thumbnails". If you don't set a value and the layout is set to "thumbnails", transparent pixels will be replaced with white pixels. Examples: #FF0000, #12A2C3.

data.name: plDisplayDocumentModified.Help
data.value: Select this option to view the name of the person that last modified as well as the date of the document in the Document grid.

data.name: ExtensionsNoHostExtensions.Text
data.value: There are no allowable file extensions defined at Host level.
